newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-MIM says 1996/97 will be difficult.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-MIM says 1996/97 will be difficult.

text.p: Mining house MIM Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday its current financial year will be difficult, especially due to the current level of copper prices.

"Taking into account economic and market conditions and the volatility of prices and exchange rates, it is very hard to forecast the financial result for 1996/97," the company said in the outlook section of its 1995/96 annual report.
"However, given the present level of copper prices in particular, a difficult year is in prospect," it said.
MIM also said its gearing will increase due to funding requirements for new local and overseas projects.

MIM said its new projects under construction, the Alumbrera copper mine in Argentina, the Ernest Henry copper/gold project in Queensland, and the Enterprise base metals mine near Mount Isa in Queensland, will not contribute to 1996/97 earnings.
"While MIM is well placed to fund these projects, gearing will increase during the year," the company said.

It said metal markets were still feeling the effects of a substantial fall in the price of copper, MIM's single most important product, due to the market manipulation scandal late last financial year.
"Continuing low world stock levels provide some underpinning of the price although this could change as new production outstrips consumption in the next 12 months," MIM said.
"The aftermath of the copper market revelations continues to exert a depressing influence on the market for other metals," MIM said.
It said zinc prices were not likely to rise substantially, lead prices can be expected to hold, and there were no strong guides to the future price of gold and silver.
"Fluctuations in currency exchange rates will also directly affect returns to the company."
MIM achieved a net profit of A$170.6 million in 1995/96 compared with a net loss of A$216.1 million a year earlier.
The company said it was now entering a new phase which had the objectives of higher profits and greater shareholder wealth.
"But of course, much will depend on commodity prices and currency fluctuations but at least the controllable issues are understood."
It said this phase, which includes the opening of new projects, could span two years and coincided with the three year investment plan for its core Mount Isa operations.
